objectives: Search for and characterize a variety of rocks and soils that hold clues to past water activity
Determine the distribution and composition of minerals, rocks, and soils surrounding the landing site
Determine what geologic processes have shaped the local terrain
Perform calibration and validation of surface observations made by instruments on Mars orbiters
Search for iron-containing minerals that may have formed in water
Assess past environmental conditions for habitability
funFacts: Originally designed for a 90-day mission, Opportunity operated for almost 15 years (5,352 sols or 5,498 Earth days) from 2004 to 2018
The rover traveled 28.06 miles (45.16 km), holding the off-Earth roving distance record until 2024
It discovered strong evidence that Mars once had liquid water on its surface, including rocks formed in water and mineral deposits left by evaporating water
Opportunity survived multiple Martian dust storms before the final planet-encircling storm in June 2018 blocked sunlight to its solar panels
The rover's final transmission on June 10, 2018, indicated critically low power, and its last message was interpreted as 'My battery is low and it's getting dark'
It took over 217,594 images during its mission, including numerous panoramas
The rover was named by Sofi Collis, a 9-year-old Russian-American girl, in a NASA essay contest
Opportunity discovered small spherical hematite concretions nicknamed 'blueberries' that formed in water billions of years ago
The rover operated through five brutal Martian winters, surviving temperatures as low as -148°F (-100°C) at night
Opportunity weighed 384 pounds (174 kg) on Earth and about 145 pounds (66 kg) on Mars
It was powered entirely by solar panels, generating about 140 watts at the start of the mission
The rover landed in Meridiani Planum using airbags, bouncing more than 26 times before coming to rest
Opportunity's twin, Spirit, landed on the opposite side of Mars three weeks earlier
The rover discovered clay minerals that form in neutral, watery conditions - evidence of potentially habitable ancient environments
It climbed out of Victoria Crater after spending nearly two years exploring its interior
Opportunity found evidence of ancient hot springs or steam vents through the discovery of gypsum veins
The mission cost approximately $400 million for the rover, plus about $20 million per year for operations
The rover's computer was a 20 MHz RAD6000 processor with 128 MB of RAM and 256 MB of flash storage
Opportunity experienced occasional 'senior moments' as flash memory degraded, requiring periodic reformatting
NASA made over 1,000 attempts to contact Opportunity after the 2018 dust storm before declaring the mission complete in February 2019
